question.title: springdoc ignores @Parameter(hidden = true) on @QuerydslPredicate
question.body:
I am using springdoc 2.8.13 with Spring Boot and QueryDSL. Here’s a controller endpoint that accepts a QueryDSL predicate:

@GetMapping("/users")
public ResponseEntity<?> users(
    @Parameter(hidden = true) 
    @QuerydslPredicate(root = User.class) Predicate predicate) {
    ...
}

Even though the parameter is annotated with @Parameter(hidden = true), the generated OpenAPI spec still contains query parameters for properties in the User class.

My goal is to hide this parameter completely from the OpenAPI documentation.

Question:

Is there a way to globally disable QueryDSL parameter handling in springdoc?

What I’ve tried / workaround:

Currently I’m exposing an empty QuerydslPredicateOperationCustomizer bean to prevent parameter expansion.

@Bean
public QuerydslPredicateOperationCustomizer querydslPredicateOperationCustomizer() {
    return null;
}

Environment:

  • Spring Boot 3.5.6
  • springdoc 2.8.13

answers.body:
Yes, that is correct approach, also add your yaml.

springdoc.api-docs.querydsl.enabled=true

You should not return null try to expose remove params in any operation.

@Configuration
public class OpenApiConfig {

    @Bean
    public QuerydslPredicateOperationCustomizer querydslPredicateOperationCustomizer() {
        return (operation, handlerMethod) -> {
            if (operation.getParameters() != null) {
                List<Parameter> filteredParameters = operation.getParameters().stream()
                        .filter(param -> !"predicate".equals(param.getName()))
                        .collect(Collectors.toList());
                operation.setParameters(filteredParameters);
            }
            return operation;
        };
    }
}

79774460.body: Is springdoc.api-docs.querydsl.enabled a valid property?    By returning an empty QuerydslPredicateOperationCustomizer bean Predicate parameters are not handled by springdoc which is just what want.
